title: Utf8b4pqw77ip Pendles Big Swing
text:
Synopsis
Pendle is expanding its yield trading protocol beyond Ethereum in 2025, targeting perpetual funding rates and exploring non-EVM chains while positioning itself as a bridge between traditional and decentralized finance.

Key Insights
- Pendle grew its Total Value Locked (TVL) to $4.4 billion and daily trading volumes to $96 million in 2024, representing 20x and 100x increases respectively
- In 2025, Pendle plans to target perpetual funding rates, enabling protocols like Ethena to lock in predictable yields
- The protocol is expanding to non-EVM chains including Solana, Hyperliquid, and Ton
- Pendle is developing a KYC'd product for regulated entities and Islamic funds to access crypto yields
- The protocol has effectively become a token launchpad, demonstrated by accumulating over $1 billion in TVL for Berachain markets before its genesis airdrop
- Bitcoin saw strong institutional inflows in January, rising 9% to close at $104k, with ETFs attracting $5.26 billion in net inflows
- Ethereum ended January at $2.7k, with ETH ETF AUM surpassing $10 billion and stablecoin market cap reaching a record $117.5 billion
